com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting.Item

  • public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    A data transfer object containing data about a single item within a transaction; the item has an amount which is a debit or credit against a specific account; it also may have an optional set of Reimbursement objects that represent links from receivable items to reimbursing items.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Item.Reimbursement
      An association class that links this item to a reimbursing item; valid only for items with receivable accounts.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(Transaction transaction,
            java.lang.Double amount,
            Account account,
            java.lang.Boolean debit,
            java.lang.Boolean checked)
        Create an Item object.
        Parameters:
        transaction - the parent transaction that owns this item
        amount - the dollar amount of the item
        account - the account to which the item applies
        debit - whether the item is a debit (true) or credit (false) item
        checked - whether the item has been reconciled against an external data source; default false

      • getReimbursements

        public java.util.Set<Item.Reimbursement> getReimbursements()
        Get a thread-safe set of the reimbursements against this receivable. If this is not a receivable item, returns an empty set
        Returns:
        a set of reimbursements or an empty set if not a receivable

      • isDebit

        Is the item is a debit item?
        Returns:
        true if debit, false if credit

      • isChecked

        public java.lang.Boolean isChecked()
        Has the item been reconciled?
        Returns:
        true if reconciled, false if not

      • reimburse

        public void reimburse(Item reimbursingItem,
                      java.lang.Double reimbursedAmount,
                      java.lang.Double allocatedAmount)
        Create a Reimbursement link and add it to the reimbursements for this item and to the reimbursements in the reimbursing item. The account for this item and the account for the reimbursing item must be the same. The allocated amount is optional and defaults to 0.00. The reimbursing amount must be less than or equal to the amount from the reimbursing item. The sum of the reimbursed and allocated amounts for all Reimbursements must be less than or equal to the amount of this item.
        Parameters:
        reimbursingItem - the reimbursing item, required
        reimbursedAmount - the amount reimbursed by the reimbursing item, required
        allocatedAmount - the amount written off by this item, optional, default 0.090

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
